meanings.definition: The quality or state of being excessively prone to engage in lawsuits.
meanings.sent1: Her litigiousnesses caused her to sue anyone over the smallest disagreement.
meanings.sent2: His litigiousnesses often led to lengthy court battles over minor issues.
meanings.sent3: The litigiousnesses of the neighbors turned the peaceful neighborhood into a legal battleground.
meanings.sent4: The company's litigiousnesses were like a never-ending legal storm, always brewing.
meanings.sent5: The lawyer's litigiousnesses were so extreme that even his colleagues were surprised.

meanings.definition: The tendency to engage in legal disputes or litigation.
meanings.sent1: The litigiousnesses of the company resulted in multiple lawsuits every year.
meanings.sent2: His litigiousnesses often made him a familiar face in the courthouse.
meanings.sent3: The litigiousnesses of the siblings turned family gatherings into legal showdowns.
meanings.sent4: The town's litigiousnesses were like a tangled web of never-ending legal battles.
meanings.sent5: Her litigiousnesses were so well-known that even the judges took notice.
